When mental health comes up in classes at college I charge head first into the conversation. I don't hide it, I fully admit it because it's something I will have for the rest of my life. It's always there, no use hiding it.

When I was a teenager I had long hair and was about 240 pounds.  Cystic acne kicked my ass pretty hard, my face is permanently scarred. (Couldn't take accutane because mental illness) The insults and degredation from both gay men and my peers was consistent to the point I became entirely antisocial. 

Fast forward to my 20s, I'm 188 pounds of (mostly) lean muscle with short hair. Men never comment on my acne anymore, I get treated a lot better. It's gross. No one ever deserves to be treated poorly because of their weight.
